Rule1063¶"A water boundary may be adopted"¶"An existing water boundary may be adopted when the margin of the water body has moved as a result of accretion only if all of the following are true:

column2: - the margin of the water body has not also moved as a result of erosion or the water boundary is an accepted boundary
- the CSD does not have a survey purpose that is a claim for accretion."¶"Cadastral Survey Rules 2021: r 10(2)(b)"

column1: Rule1068¶"A water centreline boundary may be adopted"¶"An existing irregular boundary that followed the centre-line of a water body may be adopted only if the existing irregular boundary is adopted as a water centre-line boundary."¶"Cadastral Survey Rules 2021: r 11(2)"
Rule1393¶"A water centreline boundary use"¶"A new boundary must not be a water centre-line boundary."¶"Cadastral Survey Rules 2021: r 11(3)"

Rule1031¶"Acceptance of existing boundary 2"¶"A boundary that defines a primary parcel must not be an accepted boundary if there is a risk of the boundary encroaching on another parcel."¶"Cadastral Survey Rules 2021: r 15(2)(a)"

Rule1032¶"Acceptance of existing boundary 3"¶"A boundary that defines a new primary parcel must not be an accepted boundary if the primary parcel is not a majority successor parcel."¶"Cadastral Survey Rules 2021: r 15(2)(b)"
Rule1033¶"Acceptance of existing boundary 4"¶"A boundary that defines a primary parcel must not be an accepted boundary if all of the following are false:

column2: - the boundary is a right-line boundary that does not have a boundary bearing or have a boundary distance in an approved CSD
- the boundary has a boundary bearing that is a magnetic bearing and the reorientation of the boundary bearing cannot be determined without measurement

- the boundary defines a balance parcel that is included in a title that is to remain limited as to parcels and accuracy [relative] between boundary points included in the boundary does not meet class C accuracy

- the boundary defines a balance parcel that is included in a title that is to remain a Hawkes Bay interim title and accuracy [relative] between boundary points included in the boundary does not meet class C accuracy
- the boundary is a water boundary or a water centre-line boundary that defines a balance parcel that is included in a title that is to remain limited as to parcels
- the boundary is a water boundary or a water centre-line boundary that defines a balance parcel that is included in a title that is to remain Hawkes bay interim title
- the boundary is an existing irregular boundary."¶"Cadastral Survey Rules 2021: r 15(2)(c)"

column1: Rule1040¶"Acceptance of existing boundary point"¶"A boundary point must be accepted if the boundary point is included in an accepted boundary."¶"Cadastral Survey Rules 2021: r 15(2); r 54"
Rule1286¶"Accepting existing water boundaries"¶"A boundary must be considered an accepted water boundary if all of the following are true:

column2: - the boundary is a new water boundary coinciding with an existing water boundary that defines a primary parcel
- the boundary defines a non-primary parcel over a hydro parcel.

A new water boundary that defines a non-primary parcel coinciding with an existing water boundary that defines a primary parcel must be considered an accepted water boundary only if the non-primary parcel overlies a hydro parcel."¶"Cadastral Survey Rules 2021: r 65; r 67"

column1: Rule1072¶"Accounting for erosion when water boundary not accepted"¶"An existing water boundary must be defined by survey if all of the following are true:

column2: - the margin of the water body has moved as a result of erosion
- the water boundary is not an accepted boundary."¶"Cadastral Survey Rules 2021: r 10(2)(a)"

column1: Rule1083¶"Accretion, stream bed and adverse possesion area"¶"An area [quantity] must be assigned to a portion of land that has any of the following survey purpose:

column2: - a claim for accretion
- a claim for a dry stream bed
- a claim for adverse possession."¶"Cadastral Survey Rules 2021: r 41(3)"

column1: Rule1458¶"Accuracy [positional] for right line boundary intersecting a water or irregular boundary 1"¶"The boundary bearing of a right line boundary that intersects a water or irregular boundary must be defined to a level of accuracy [positional] that is consistent with the accuracy class of the right line boundary."¶"Cadastral Survey Rules 2021: r 30(a)"

Rule1459¶"Accuracy [positional] for right line boundary intersecting a water or irregular boundary 2"¶"The boundary distance of a right line boundary that intersects a water or irregular boundary must be defined to a level of accuracy [positional] that is consistent with the accuracy [positional] of the water or irregular boundary."¶"Cadastral Survey Rules 2021: r 30(b)"

Rule1473¶"Accuracy [positional] for right line boundary intersecting an accepted water boundary 1"¶"The boundary bearing of a right line boundary that intersects an accepted water boundary must be defined to a level of accuracy [positional] that is consistent with the accuracy class of the right line boundary."¶"Cadastral Survey Rules 2021: r 69(1)(a)"

Rule1474¶"Accuracy [positional] for right line boundary intersecting an accepted water boundary 2"¶"The boundary distance of a right line boundary that intersects an accepted water boundary must be defined to a level of accuracy [positional] that is consistent with the accuracy [positional] of the water boundary."¶"Cadastral Survey Rules 2021: r 69(1)(b)"

Rule1475¶"Accuracy [positional] for right line boundary intersecting an offset water boundary 1"¶"A boundary bearing of a right line boundary that intersects an offset water boundary must meet a level of accuracy [positional] that is consistent with the accuracy class of the right line boundary."¶"Cadastral Survey Rules 2021: r 69(2)(a)"

Rule1476¶"Accuracy [positional] for right line boundary intersecting an offset water boundary 2"¶"The boundary distance of a right line boundary that intersects an offset water boundary need not be defined."¶"Cadastral Survey Rules 2021: r 69(2)(b)"

Rule1088¶"Accuracy sufficient to avoid overlap"¶"A boundary point that is included in a new boundary must be considered a boundary point that is accurately defined only if the accuracy [relative] between the boundary point and each other boundary point that is included in another boundary is less than the horizontal distance and less than the slope distance between the boundary points.

column2: A boundary must be defined
must be determined to a sufficient level of accuracy to address the risk of incompatible rights overlapping"¶"Cadastral Survey Rules 2021: r 28"

column1: Rule1471¶"Accurate definition of boundaries"¶"A boundary must be accurately defined."¶"Cadastral Survey Rules 2021: Part 4 subpart 2"

Rule1488¶"Accurate relation of non-primary parcel boundaries to underlying parcel boundaries"¶"A non-primary parcel boundary must be accurately related to each boundary that defines an underlying parcel if the underlying parcel is not created by the same cadastral survey as the non-primary parcel."¶"Cadastral Survey Rules 2021: r 27(4)"
Rule1184¶"Adopted mark not used as PRM"¶"An adopted mark must not be used as a permanent reference mark."¶"Cadastral Survey Rules 2021: r 33(2)"
Rule1498¶"Adpoted information from source"¶"An adopted piece of information must be copied from the source of the information without change if the information is not any of the following:

column2: - the conversion of units of measure
- a bearing adjustment."¶"Cadastral Survey Rules 2021: r 75(1)"

column1: Rule1442¶"Ambiguity and overlap of water or irregular boundaries"¶"A water or irregular boundary that is not an accepted boundary must have its position determined to a level of accuracy [positional] that prevents a parcel defined by the boundary overlapping another parcel."¶"Cadastral Survey Rules 2021: r 29(2)(a); r 29(3)"
Rule1005¶"Approval of CSD 1"¶"A CSD may be an approved CSD only if the CSD is a complete CSD."¶"Cadastral Survey Rules 2021: Part 7"
Rule1108¶"Balance parcel constraint"¶"A balance parcel may be derived only from any of the following primary parcels:

column2: - a railway parcel that is not in a record of title
- a road parcel
- a fixed marginal strip
- the bed of a lake
- the bed of a river
- the bed of a stream
- the bed of the sea
- an access way that is not in a record of title
- a service lane that is not in a record of title."¶"Cadastral Survey Rules 2021: sch 2, definition of \"balance parcel\""

column1: Rule1416¶"Boundary class exceptions"¶"A water or irregular boundary must not be considered any of the following:

column2: - a class A boundary
- a class B boundary
- a class C boundary
- a class D boundary."¶"Cadastral Survey Rules 2021: r 29(1)"

column1: Rule1353¶"Boundary converts boundary"¶"A boundary must be considered a boundary that is converted if the boundary is replaced by another boundary that is not of the same boundary form."¶"Cadastral Survey Rules 2021: r 10(3)(b); r 14(c); r 29(1)(f); r 46(6); r 9(3)"

Rule1037¶"Boundary for balance or residual parcel being accepted"¶"An existing boundary that defines a balance parcel or defines a residue parcel may be an accepted boundary only if there is no other new parcel defined by the boundary."¶"Cadastral Survey Rules 2021: r 15(3)"

Rule1251¶"Boundary mark on existing boundary point 1"¶"A mark must be placed at a boundary point that is included in an existing boundary that defines a new primary parcel if it is practicable for the mark to be placed at the boundary point and any of the following is true:

column2: - the boundary point is subject to conflict
- the definition of the boundary in an approved CSD is not sufficient to determine the compliance of the boundary with the applicable accuracy standard
- the boundary is only defined in a diagram on transfer
- the boundary defines a parcel from which limitation as to parcels is being uplifted
- the parcel is subject to a claim for adverse possession
- the boundary point is recorded in a Maori Land CSD that is annotated \"computed plan – areas and boundaries not defined by survey\"
- the boundary is recorded in a Maori Land CSD that is annotated \"computed plan – areas and boundaries not defined by survey\"

- the boundary point is an unmarked boundary point that was included in boundaries that defined only non-primary parcels."¶"Cadastral Survey Rules 2021: r 35(2)(a); r 35(2)(b); r 35(2)(c); r 35(2)(d); r 35(2)(f); r 35(2)(g); r 35(2)(h)"

column1: Rule1420¶"Boundary mark on existing boundary point 2"¶"A mark must be placed at a boundary point that is included in an existing boundary that defines a new primary parcel if all of the following are true:

column2: - it is practicable for the mark to be placed at the boundary point
- the boundary defines a parcel that is part of a Hawkes Bay interim title
- one of the survey purposes is an application to make the Hawkes Bay interim title conclusive."¶"Cadastral Survey Rules 2021: r 35(2)(e)"

column1: Rule1240¶"Boundary mark on new boundary point"¶"A mark need not be placed at a new boundary point that is included in a boundary that defines a new primary parcel if any the following are true:

column2: - all parcels that are adjacent to the boundary point are new parcels intended to be owned by the Crown
- all parcels that are adjacent to the boundary point are new parcels intended to be owned by the same territorial authority
- the Maori Land Court does not require a mark to be placed at a boundary point that is included in the boundary
- all parcels that are adjacent to the boundary point are or will be held in common ownership
- the parcels on each side of the boundary are or will be subject to a reciprocal right of way
- the terrain, ground cover, or protected vegetation make it unlikely that the boundary point will need to be physically located
- the boundary point results from an existing water or irregular boundary being converted to a right-line boundary that is a class B boundary
- the boundary point coincides with a water boundary
- the boundary point coincides with a water centre-line boundary
- it is not practicable for a mark to be placed at the boundary point."¶"Cadastral Survey Rules 2021: r 35(1)"

column1: Rule1252¶"Boundary mark on parcel that is limited as to parcels"¶"A boundary mark must not be placed at a boundary point that is included in a boundary that defines a parcel that is limited as to parcels."¶"Cadastral Survey Rules 2021: r 35(3)"
Rule1177¶"Boundary mark reference to permanent reference mark"¶"A referenced boundary mark must be referenced by a permanent reference mark."¶"Cadastral Survey Rules 2021: r 31(b)"

Rule1434¶"Boundary point coincides boundary"¶"A boundary point must be considered a boundary point that is coincident with a boundary if the boundary point is intended to lie on the line of the boundary."¶"Cadastral Survey Rules 2021: r 35(1)(g); r 61(3); r 89(g)(i)"
Rule1250¶"Boundary point reference to permanent reference mark"¶"A referenced boundary point must be referenced by a permanent reference mark."¶"Cadastral Survey Rules 2021: r 31(a)"

Rule1178¶"Boundary point reference to PRM Class A"¶"A class A boundary point must be less than or equal to 150 m from a permanent reference mark if the boundary point is a referenced point."¶"Cadastral Survey Rules 2021: r 32(1)(a); r 32(2); r 51(2)(e); r 64; r 70(1)"

Rule1179¶"Boundary point reference to PRM Class B"¶"A class B boundary point must be less than or equal to 500 m from a permanent reference mark if the boundary point is a referenced point."¶"Cadastral Survey Rules 2021: r 32(1)(b); r 32(2); r 51(2)(f); r 64; r 70(1)"
Rule1180¶"Boundary point reference to PRM Class C"¶"A class C boundary point must be less than or equal to 1000 m from a permanent reference mark if any of the following is true:

column2: - the boundary point is a referenced boundary point
- the boundary point is a referenced boundary mark
- the boundary point is a referenced height-limited boundary point."¶"Cadastral Survey Rules 2021: r 32(1)(c); r 32(2)"

column1: Rule1091¶"Centre-line easement"¶"An existing centre-line easement parcel need not be represented as a polygon or polyhedron only if any of the following is true:

column2: - the width of the centre-line easement is unknown
- the centre-line easement is an accepted boundary."¶"Cadastral Survey Rules 2021: r 49"

column1: Rule1496¶"Certification of CSD"¶"A CSD must be certified and dated by a cadastral surveyor as follows:

column2: \"I [name], being a licensed cadastral surveyor, certify that—
(a) this dataset provided by me and its related survey are accurate, correct, and in accordance with the Cadastral Survey Act 2002 and the Cadastral Survey Rules 2020; and
(b) the survey was undertaken by me or under my personal direction.\""¶"Cadastral Survey Rules 2021: r 73"

column1: Rule1128¶"Class A Accuracy"¶"An accuracy [relative] between a boundary point and another boundary point must be considered a class A accuracy if all of the following are true:

column2: - the accuracy [relative] is less than or equal to 0.06 + (0.00015 * the horizontal distance between the boundary points)
- the accuracy [relative] is less than or equal to 0.06 + (0.00015 * the slope distance between the boundary points)."¶"Cadastral Survey Rules 2021: r 27(1)(i)"

column1: Rule1343¶"Class A Boundary"¶"A boundary must be considered a class A boundary if any of the following are true:

column2: - the boundary is in an urban area
- the boundary is adjoining an urban area
- the boundary is intended as a result of a cadastral survey to be in an urban area
- the boundary defines a parcel that is used intensively for commercial, industrial, or residential purposes

- the boundary defines a parcel that is intended as a result of a cadastral survey to be used intensively for commercial, industrial, or residential purposes."¶"Cadastral Survey Rules 2021: r 22(1); r 22(2); r 50"

column1: Rule1348¶"Class A Boundary Point"¶"A boundary point must be considered a class A boundary point if the boundary point is included in a class A boundary."¶"Cadastral Survey Rules 2021: r 22(1); r 22(2); r 26; r 50"
Rule1131¶"Class B Accuracy"¶"An accuracy [relative] between a boundary point and another boundary point must be considered a class B accuracy only if all of the following are true:

column2: - The accuracy [relative] is less than or equal to 0.30 + (0.0006 * the horizontal distance between the boundary points)
- The accuracy [relative] is less than or equal to 0.30 + (0.0006 * the slope distance between the boundary points)."¶"Cadastral Survey Rules 2021: r 27(1)(ii)"

column1: Rule1344¶"Class B Boundary"¶"A boundary must be considered a class B boundary if the boundary is not any of the following:

column2: - a class A boundary
- a class C boundary
- a class D boundary."¶"Cadastral Survey Rules 2021: r 23; r 50"

column1: Rule1349¶"Class B Boundary Point"¶"A boundary point must be considered a class B boundary point if all of the following are true:

column2: - the boundary point is not included in a class A boundary
- the boundary point is included in a class B boundary."¶"Cadastral Survey Rules 2021: r 23; r 26; r 50"

column1: Rule1363¶"Class B non-primary parcel boundary permitted inaccurate relationship to underlying parcel"¶"A non-primary parcel boundary may be inaccurately determined in a cadastral survey if no primary parcel that underlies that non-primary parcel is created by that cadastral survey and any of the following is true:

column2: - the non-primary parcel boundary is a class B boundary

- the non-primary parcel boundary is a class A boundary and each boundary that defines a primary parcel that underlies that non-primary parcel is a class B boundary."¶"Cadastral Survey Rules 2021: r 51(1)(a)"

column1: Rule1835¶"Class B non-primary parcel boundary required inaccurate relationship to underlying parcel 1"¶"A non-primary parcel boundary must be inaccurately determined in a cadastral survey if all of the following are true:

column2: - no primary parcel that underlies that non-primary parcel is created by that cadastral survey
- no boundary that defines a primary parcel that underlies that non-primary parcel is an accurately defined boundary."¶"Cadastral Survey Rules 2021: r 51(1)(b)"

column1: Rule1840¶"Class B non-primary parcel boundary required inaccurate relationship to underlying parcel 2"¶"A non-primary parcel boundary must be inaccurately determined in a cadastral survey if all of the following are true:

column2: - a primary parcel that underlies that non-primary parcel is created by that cadastral survey
- the non-primary parcel boundary is not accurately determined to a class A boundary or class B boundary of the underlying parcel
- another non-primary parcel boundary intersects or another non-primary parcel boundary coincides with an accepted boundary of the underlying parcel."¶"Cadastral Survey Rules 2021: r 51(4); r 51(5)"

column1: Rule1133¶"Class C Accuracy"¶"An accuracy [relative] between a boundary point and another boundary point must be considered a class C accuracy only if all of the following are true:

column2: - The accuracy [relative] is less than or equal to 1.00 + (0.003 * the horizontal distance between the boundary points)
- The accuracy [relative] is less than or equal to 1.00 + (0.003 * the slope distance between the boundary points)."¶"Cadastral Survey Rules 2021: r 27(1)(iii)"

column1: Rule1345¶"Class C Boundary"¶"A primary parcel boundary must be considered a class C boundary if the boundary is an adopted boundary for which all of the following are true:

column2: - the boundary defines a majority successor parcel or a new large rural parcel

- the accuracy [relative] between boundary points that are included in the boundary is not class B accuracy or the boundary defines a parcel that is included in a title that is to remain limited as to parcels or the boundary defines a parcel that is included in a title that is to remain a Hawkes Bay interim title."¶"Cadastral Survey Rules 2021: r 24"

column1: Rule1337¶"Class C boundary for non-primary parcel 1"¶"A non-primary parcel boundary must be considered a class C boundary if any of the following is true:

column2: - the boundary intersects with a boundary of a majority successor parcel
- the boundary coincides with a boundary of a majority successor parcel
- the boundary intersects with a boundary of a new large rural parcel
- the boundary coincides with a boundary of a new large rural parcel."¶"Cadastral Survey Rules 2021: r 52(1)"

column1: Rule1339¶"Class C boundary for non-primary parcel 2"¶"A non-primary parcel boundary must be considered a class C boundary if the boundary defines a covenant parcel."¶"Cadastral Survey Rules 2021: r 52(2)"
Rule1338¶"Class C boundary for non-primary parcel 3"¶"A non-primary parcel boundary must be considered a class C boundary if all of the following are true:

column2: - the boundary defines a new easement parcel
- no underlying parcel is created by the cadastral survey
- all underlying parcels are held in a single estate that has an area [quantity] greater than 100 ha."¶"Cadastral Survey Rules 2021: r 52(3)"

column1: Rule1285¶"Class C for common marine and coastal area"¶"A non-primary parcel boundary must be considered a class C boundary if the non-primary parcel is within the common marine and coastal area."¶"Cadastral Survey Rules 2021: r 66"
Rule1364¶"Class C non-primary parcel accuracy 1"¶"A non-primary parcel boundary may be inaccurately determined in a cadastral survey only if all of the following are true:

column2: - the non-primary parcel is an easement parcel or covenant parcel
- the non-primary parcel boundary is a class C boundary."¶"Cadastral Survey Rules 2021: r 53(1)"

column1: Rule1347¶"Class D Boundary"¶"A boundary must be considered a class D boundary if the boundary is an accepted boundary."¶"Cadastral Survey Rules 2021: r 25"
Rule1351¶"Class D Boundary Point"¶"A boundary point must be considered a class D boundary point if all of the following are true:

column2: - the boundary point is not included in a class A boundary
- the boundary point is not included in a class B boundary
- the boundary point is not included in a class C boundary
- the boundary point is included in a class D boundary."¶"Cadastral Survey Rules 2021: r 25; r 26"

column1: Rule1075¶"Complete CSD - movable marginal strip 1"¶"A parcel that is a movable marginal strip included in a CSD must be depicted on a title diagram as being contained within the underlying primary parcel of the movable marginal strip."¶"Cadastral Survey Rules 2021: r 99"

Rule1239¶"Connection - horizontal datum 1"¶"A boundary point that is included in a boundary that defines a new primary parcel must be connected to a cadastral survey network mark that is less than and equal to 1,000m from the boundary point by a series of vectors that consists only of vectors that are adopted or measured if any of the following is true:

column2: - the boundary point is a new boundary point
- the boundary point is a new boundary mark
- the boundary point is a old boundary mark."¶"Cadastral Survey Rules 2021: r 17(1)(a); r 17(2)"

column1: Rule1123¶"Connection - horizontal datum 2"¶"A boundary point that is included in a boundary that defines a new primary parcel may be connected to only cadastral survey network marks that are more than 1,000m from the boundary point only if all of the following are true:

column2: - there are no existing cadastral survey network marks that are less than or equal to 1,000m from the boundary point
- the boundary point is connected to the cadastral survey network marks by a series of vectors that consists only of vectors that are adopted or measured
- the boundary point is a new boundary point or a new boundary mark or a old boundary mark."¶"Cadastral Survey Rules 2021: r 17"

column1: Rule1107¶"Content of simple boundary reinstatement CSD"¶"A simple boundary reinstatement CSD must include all of the following:

column2: - a record of survey
- a survey report
- a dataset description that includes the survey purpose and the legal description of the parcel whose boundary is being reinstated
- a statement of certification."¶"Cadastral Survey Rules 2021: r 117"

column1: Rule1259¶"CSD number for unit title development"¶"A CSD for a unit title development that is to be deposited in substitution for a previously deposited CSD must retain the same CSD number as the previously deposited CSD."¶"Cadastral Survey Rules 2021: r 59"
Rule1497¶"Data compliance"¶"A CSD must comply with the cadastral survey rules when providing data about the following:

column2: - a bearing
- a distance
- a reduced level
- an area [quantity]."¶"Cadastral Survey Rules 2021: r 74(3)"

column1: Rule1142¶"Definition of existing boundary point being marked"¶"An existing boundary point that has a new mark being placed at the boundary point must be defined by survey."¶"Cadastral Survey Rules 2021: r 13(d)"

Rule1143¶"Definition of existing boundary point required to be marked"¶"A boundary point that is included in an existing boundary that defines a new primary parcel must be defined by survey if any of the following are true:

column2: - the boundary point is subject to conflict

- the boundary point is included in an existing boundary that is defined in an approved CSD where the definition of the existing boundary is insufficient for determining the compliance of the boundary with the applicable accuracy standard
- the boundary point is included in an existing boundary that is only defined in a diagram on transfer
- the boundary point is included in an existing boundary that defines a parcel from which limitation as to parcels is being uplifted
- the boundary point is included in an existing boundary of a parcel from which the interim nature of the Hawkes Bay interim title is being removed
- the boundary point is included in an existing boundary of a parcel that is subject to a claim for adverse possession
- the boundary point is recorded in a Maori land CSD that is annotated \"computed plan-areas and boundaries not defined by survey\"
- the boundary point was an unmarked boundary point that is included in a boundary defining a non-primary parcel."¶"Cadastral Survey Rules 2021: r 13(d); r 35(2)"

column1: Rule1140¶"Definition of new boundary point"¶"A new boundary point must be defined by survey."¶"Cadastral Survey Rules 2021: r 13(b)"
Rule1139¶"Definition of new irregular boundary"¶"A new irregular boundary must be defined by survey."¶"Cadastral Survey Rules 2021: r 13(a)"
Rule1137¶"Definition of new water boundary"¶"A new water boundary must be defined by survey."¶"Cadastral Survey Rules 2021: r 13(a)"

Rule1141¶"Definition of right line boundary replacing irregular, water or water centreline boundary"¶"A new right-line boundary must be defined by survey if the right-line boundary converts a water or irregular boundary."¶"Cadastral Survey Rules 2021: r 13(c)"

Rule1333¶"Derivation of acceptance of non-primary boundaries"¶"An existing non-primary parcel boundary must be considered an accepted boundary if the boundary is within a large rural parcel defined by accepted boundaries."¶"Cadastral Survey Rules 2021: r 54"

Rule1489¶"Derivation of accurate relation of boundaries"¶"A boundary may be considered a boundary accurately related to another boundary only if the boundary consists of boundary points that are all accurately related to each boundary point that is included in the other boundary."¶"Cadastral Survey Rules 2021: r 27(4)"

Rule1470¶"Derivation of accurately defined boundary"¶"A boundary must be considered a boundary that is accurately defined if each boundary point that is included in the boundary is an accurately defined boundary point."¶"Cadastral Survey Rules 2021: Part 4 subpart 2"

Rule1830¶"Derivation of accurately determined non-primary parcel boundary"¶"A non-primary parcel boundary must be considered a non-primary parcel boundary that is accurately determined if at least two boundary points that is included in any non-primary parcel boundaries are each connected to different boundary points that is included in boundaries defining any primary parcel that underlies the non-primary parcel."¶"Cadastral Survey Rules 2021: Inferred from r 89(g)(i)"
Rule1144¶"Derivation of affected by ground movement"¶"A boundary must be considered to be affected by ground movement if all of the following are true:

column2: - ground movement has distorted land crossed by the boundary in excess of the tolerance for the accuracy class relevant to the boundary
- the boundary has not been subsequently defined by survey and recorded in an approved CSD."¶"Cadastral Survey Rules 2021: r 108; Sch 2, definition of \"affected boundary\""

column1: Rule1503¶"Derivation of boundary defined by survey"¶"A boundary must be considered a boundary that is defined by survey if a cadastral surveyor performs all of the following:

column2: - gathers all evidence relevant to the definition of the boundary
- interprets that evidence in accordance with all relevant enactments and rules of law
- uses that evidence to determine the correct position of the boundary in relation to other boundaries."¶"Cadastral Survey Rules 2021: r 6; https://jira.linz.govt.nz/browse/BRC-160"

column1: Rule1838¶"Derivation of boundary point defined by survey"¶"A boundary point must be considered a boundary point that is defined by survey if a cadastral surveyor performs all of the following:

column2: - gathers all evidence relevant to the definition of the boundary point
- interprets that evidence in accordance with all relevant enactments and rules of law
- uses that evidence to determine the correct position of the boundary point in relation to other boundary points."¶"Cadastral Survey Rules 2021: r 6; https://jira.linz.govt.nz/browse/BRC-160"

column1: Rule1379¶"Derivation of boundary point is subject to conflict"¶"A boundary point must be considered a boundary point subject to conflict if the boundary point is included in a boundary subject to conflict."¶"Cadastral Survey Rules 2021: sch 2, definition of \"conflict\""

Rule1465¶"Derivation of class A accurate relation of boundary points"¶"A class A boundary point must be considered a boundary point accurately related to another class A boundary point only if the accuracy [relative] between the boundary points is class A accuracy."¶"Cadastral Survey Rules 2021: r 22(1); r 22(2); r 27(1); r 27(2); r 27(3); r 27(4)"

Rule1378¶"Derivation of class A boundary is subject to accuracy conflict with estate boundary"¶"A class A boundary that is recorded in an approved CSD must be considered a boundary subject to conflict if all of the following are true:

column2: - the accuracy [relative] between a boundary point that is included in the boundary and another boundary point that is included in an estate boundary that coincides with the boundary is not class A accuracy
- the conflict is not resolved in another approved CSD."¶"Cadastral Survey Rules 2021: sch 2, definition of \"conflict\" (a)(i), (b)"

column1: Rule1430¶"Derivation of class A boundary is subject to position conflict with estate boundary"¶"A class A boundary recorded in an approved CSD must be considered a boundary subject to conflict if all of the following are true:

column2: - the accuracy [relative] between boundary points that are included in the boundary is not class A when other approved CSDs that record the boundary are taken into consideration
- the conflict is not resolved in another approved CSD."¶"Cadastral Survey Rules 2021: sch 2, definition of \"conflict\" (a)(i), (b)"

column1: Rule1466¶"Derivation of class B accurate relation of boundary points"¶"A class B boundary point must be considered a boundary point accurately related to another boundary point only if the accuracy [relative] between the boundary points is class B accuracy when the other boundary point is any of:

column2: - a class A boundary point
- a class B boundary point."¶"Cadastral Survey Rules 2021: r 23; r 27(1); r 27(2); r 27(3); r 27(4)"

column1: Rule1422¶"Derivation of class B boundary is subject to conflict with estate boundary"¶"A class B boundary must be considered a boundary subject to conflict if all of the following are true:

column2: - the boundary is an existing boundary

- the accuracy [relative] between a boundary point that is included in the boundary and a boundary point that is included in an estate boundary that coincides with the boundary is not class B."¶"Cadastral Survey Rules 2021: sch 2, definition of \"conflict\" (a)(i), (b)"

column1: Rule1467¶"Derivation of class C accurate relation of boundary points"¶"A class C boundary point must be considered a boundary point accurately related to another boundary point only if the accuracy [relative] between the boundary points is class C accuracy when the other boundary point is any of:

column2: - a class A boundary point
- a class B boundary point
- a class C boundary point."¶"Cadastral Survey Rules 2021: r 24; r 27(1); r 27(2); r 27(3); r 27(4)"

column1: Rule1421¶"Derivation of class C boundary is subject to conflict with estate boundary"¶"A class C boundary must be considered a boundary subject to conflict if all of the following are true:

column2: - the boundary is an existing boundary

- the accuracy [relative] between a boundary point that is included in the boundary and a boundary point that is included in an estate boundary that coincides with the boundary is not class C."¶"Cadastral Survey Rules 2021: sch 2, definition of \"conflict\" (a)(i), (b)"

column1: Rule1350¶"Derivation of Class C Boundary Point"¶"A boundary point must be considered a class C boundary point if all of the following are true:

column2: - the boundary point is not included in a class A boundary
- the boundary point is not included in a class B boundary
- the boundary point is included in a class C boundary."¶"Cadastral Survey Rules 2021: r 24; r 26"

column1: Rule1468¶"Derivation of class D accurate relation of boundary points"¶"A class D boundary point must be considered a boundary point accurately related to another boundary point only if the accuracy [relative] between the boundary points is class D accuracy."¶"Cadastral Survey Rules 2021: r 25; r 27(1); r 27(2); r 27(3); r 27(4)"
Rule1423¶"Derivation of class D boundary is subject to conflict with estate boundary"¶"A class D boundary must be considered a boundary subject to conflict if all of the following are true:

column2: - the boundary is an existing boundary

- the accuracy [relative] between a boundary point that is included in the boundary and a boundary point that is included in an estate boundary that coincides with the boundary is not class D."¶"Cadastral Survey Rules 2021: sch 2, definition of \"conflict\" (a)(i), (b)"

column1: Rule1003¶"Derivation of Complete CSD 1"¶"A CSD must be considered a complete CSD only if the CSD consists of a record of survey."¶"Cadastral Survey Rules 2021: r 71(a)"

Rule1004¶"Derivation of Complete CSD 2"¶"A CSD for a cadastral survey that creates a parcel must be considered a complete CSD only if the CSD consists of a title plan."¶"Cadastral Survey Rules 2021: r 71(b)"
Rule1092¶"Derivation of Complete CSD 3"¶"A CSD must be considered a complete CSD only if the CSD consists of a dataset description."¶"Cadastral Survey Rules 2021: r 71(c)"
Rule1096¶"Derivation of Complete CSD 4"¶"A CSD must be considered a complete CSD only if the CSD consists of a survey report."¶"Cadastral Survey Rules 2021: r 71(d)"

Rule1429¶"Derivation of Complete CSD 5"¶"A CSD must be considered a complete CSD only if the CSD consists of all relevant field information related to that CSD in a form that ensures permanent usability."¶"Cadastral Survey Rules 2021: r 71(e)"

Rule1097¶"Derivation of Complete CSD 6"¶"A CSD must be considered a complete CSD only if the CSD includes an accurate record of the position of each new water boundary that is in that CSD."¶"Cadastral Survey Rules 2021: r 71(f)"

Rule1493¶"Derivation of Complete CSD 7"¶"A CSD must be considered a complete CSD only if the CSD includes a certification of survey plan approval if the CSD is for a Crown subdivision."¶"Cadastral Survey Rules 2021: r 72(b)"

Rule1093¶"Derivation of dataset description 1"¶"A dataset description included in a CSD must have a parcel ID for each primary parcel that is created by the cadastral survey."¶"Cadastral Survey Rules 2021: r 71(c)(i)"
Rule1094¶"Derivation of dataset description 2"¶"A dataset description included in a CSD must have the survey purpose if the CSD is a land transfer CSD."¶"Cadastral Survey Rules 2021: r 71(c)(ii)"

Rule1095¶"Derivation of dataset description 3"¶"A dataset description included in a CSD must have a parcel ID for each underlying parcel in that CSD if the CSD is a land transfer CSD."¶"Cadastral Survey Rules 2021: r 71(c)(iii)"
Rule1172¶"Derivation of extinguished parcel"¶"An existing parcel must be considered an extinguished parcel if any of the following is true:

column2: - the existing parcel has been replaced by at least one new parcel
- the existing parcel has expired."¶"Survey Knowledge Portal: Parcel Actions; https://confluence.linz.govt.nz/display/public/OP/Parcel+Actions"

column1: Rule1831¶"Derivation of inaccurately determined class B non-primary parcel boundary"¶"A class B boundary for a non-primary parcel must be considered a non-primary parcel boundary that is inaccurately determined if all of the following are true:

column2: - none of the boundary points that is included in any of the non-primary parcel boundaries is connected to a boundary point that is included in a boundary defining a primary parcel that underlies the non-primary parcel

- two or more boundary points that is included in any of the non-primary parcel boundaries are connected to two or more permanent reference marks."¶"Cadastral Survey Rules 2021: Inferred from r 51(2)(e); Inferred from r 51(2)(f); Inferred from r 89(g)(i)"

column1: Rule1836¶"Derivation of inaccurately determined class C non-primary parcel boundary"¶"A class C boundary for a non-primary parcel must be considered a non-primary parcel boundary that is inaccurately determined if all of the following are true:

column2: - none of the boundary points that is included in any of the non-primary parcel boundaries is connected to a boundary point that is included in a boundary defining a primary parcel that underlies the non-primary parcel

- two or more boundary points that is included in any of the non-primary parcel boundaries are connected to two or more cadastral survey network marks."¶"Cadastral Survey Rules 2021: Inferred from r 53(2)(c); Inferred from r 89(g)(i)"

column1: Rule1839¶"Derivation of point connected to point"¶"A point must be considered a point connected to another point only if at least one series of vectors connects the point and the other point."¶"Inferred from Cadastral Survey Rules 2021"

Rule1405¶"Derivation of referenced boundary mark"¶"A boundary mark must be considered a referenced boundary mark if the boundary mark is included in a boundary that defines a parcel being surveyed."¶"Cadastral Survey Rules 2021: r 31(b)"
Rule1404¶"Derivation of referenced boundary point"¶"A boundary point must be considered a referenced boundary point if all of the following are true:

column2: - the boundary point is defined by survey
- the boundary point is included in a primary parcel boundary that is not a water or irregular boundary."¶"Cadastral Survey Rules 2021: r 31(a)"

column1: Rule1495¶"Derivation of referenced by"¶"A point must be considered a point referenced by a permanent reference mark only if at least one series of vectors connects the point and the permanent reference mark."¶"Inferred from Cadastral Survey Rules 2021: https://jira.linz.govt.nz/browse/BRC-173"

Rule1406¶"Derivation of referenced height-limited boundary point"¶"A new boundary point must be considered a referenced height-limited boundary point if the boundary point is included in a height limited boundary that defines a primary parcel."¶"Cadastral Survey Rules 2021: r 31(c)"

Rule1435¶"Derivation of right area non-primary parcel"¶"Only a right area that is in the common marine and coastal area may be a right area that is a category of non-primary parcel"¶"Cadastral Survey Rules 2021: sch 2, definition of \"Non-primary parcel\""

Rule1837¶"Derivation rule for parcel defined by boundary"¶"A parcel must be considered a parcel defined by a boundary if the boundary is one of the boundaries enclosing the space occupied by the parcel."¶"Cadastral Survey Rules 2021: Part 5 subpart 2"

Rule1332¶"Derivation Rule: Boundary coincides boundary"¶"A boundary must be considered a boundary coincident with another boundary if the boundary is intended to lie exactly on top of the other boundary."¶"Cadastral Survey Rules 2021: r 100(b); r 101(e); r 105(2)(c); r 110(2); r 110(6); r 111(1); r 35(1)(g); r 46(3); r 46(4); r 51(2)(a); r 51(4); r 52(1); r 53(2)(a); r 61(3); r 67; r 85(b); r 89(f)(i)"

Rule1354¶"Derivation Rule: Boundary intersects boundary"¶"A boundary must be considered a boundary that intersects another boundary if the boundaries consist of the same boundary point."¶"Cadastral Survey Rules 2021: r 110(2); r 110(6); r 111(1); r 30; r 51(2)(a); r 51(4); r 52(1); r 53(2)(a); r 68(2); r 69(1); r 69(2)"
Rule1399¶"Destroyed or not found survey mark"¶"A record of survey must identify whether a survey mark is any of the following:

column2: - searched for and not found
- destroyed."¶"Cadastral Survey Rules 2021: r 80(7)"

column1: Rule1243¶"Disturbed boundary mark removed 1"¶"A disturbed survey mark may be driven below the surface if the survey mark is categorized only as a boundary mark."¶"Cadastral Survey Rules 2021: r 37(1)"
Rule1027¶"Disturbed boundary mark removed 2"¶"A disturbed survey mark may be removed if the survey mark is categorized only as a boundary mark."¶"Cadastral Survey Rules 2021: r 37(1)"

Rule1297¶"Disturbed survey mark"¶"A survey mark must be considered a new survey mark the same survey mark type as the old survey mark if the survey mark is a disturbed survey mark."¶"Cadastral Survey Rules 2021: r 37(3)"

Rule1376¶"Easement or covenant accuracy between boundary point and adopted CSNM"¶"The accuracy [relative] between a boundary point that is included in a non-primary parcel boundary and an adopted cadastral survey network mark must not exceed 0.60 m horizontal if all of the following are true:

column2: - the boundary point is not a class D boundary point
- the non-primary parcel is an easement parcel or a covenant parcel
- the non-primary parcel boundary is inaccurately determined."¶"Cadastral Survey Rules 2021: r 53(2)(f)"

column1: Rule1375¶"Easement or covenant connected by vectors to CSNM"¶"A boundary point that is included in a non-primary parcel boundary must be connected to a cadastral survey network mark if all of the following are true:

column2: - the boundary point is not a class D boundary point
- the non-primary parcel is an easement parcel or a covenant parcel
- the non-primary parcel boundary is inaccurately determined."¶"Cadastral Survey Rules 2021: r 53(2)(e)"

column1: Rule1038¶"Existing boundary defining new large rural parcel being accepted"¶"An existing boundary that defines a new large rural parcel may be an accepted boundary only if any other new parcel defined by the boundary is a new large rural parcel."¶"Cadastral Survey Rules 2021: r 15(4)"
Rule1061¶"Existing irregular boundary on a new primary parcel"¶"A new primary parcel may be defined by an existing irregular boundary only if any of the following are true:

column2: - the irregular boundary is an accepted boundary
- the primary parcel is a majority successor parcel
- the primary parcel is a large rural parcel
- the irregular boundary was previously a water boundary."¶"Cadastral Survey Rules 2021: r 9(3)"

column1: Rule1352¶"Existing irregular boundary on a parcel"¶"An existing irregular boundary that defines a new primary parcel must be converted to right-line boundaries."¶"Cadastral Survey Rules 2021: r 9(3)"

Rule1308¶"Existing survey mark name"¶"The mark name of an existing survey mark that is not unique in a CSD may be made unique only by adding a unique numeric identifier within round brackets before the CSD number."¶"Cadastral Survey Rules 2021: r 80(3)"
Rule1257¶"Existing unit and lease boundaries accepted"¶"The boundaries of an existing unit parcel may be accepted only if all of the following are true:

column2: - the existing parcel is included in an approved CSD
- no change is made to any parcel boundary
- no change is made to the record of title of the parcel."¶"Cadastral Survey Rules 2021: r 58(1); r 58(2)"

column1: Rule1266¶"Existing unit and lease boundaries accepted 2"¶"The boundaries of an existing company lease parcel may be accepted only if all of the following are true:

column2: - the existing parcel is included in an approved CSD
- no change is made to any parcel boundary
- no change is made to the record of title of the parcel."¶"Cadastral Survey Rules 2021: r 58(1); r 58(2)"

column1: Rule1267¶"Existing unit and lease boundaries accepted 3"¶"The boundaries of an existing cross lease parcel may be accepted only if all of the following are true:

column2: - the existing parcel is included in an approved CSD
- no change is made to any parcel boundary
- no change is made to the record of title of the parcel."¶"Cadastral Survey Rules 2021: r 58(1); r 58(2)"

column1: Rule1258¶"Existing unit and lease boundary parcel appellation"¶"The existing parcel appellation of all of the following must be retained if the boundaries of the parcel are accepted:

column2: - an existing unit parcel
- an existing company lease parcel
- an existing cross lease parcel."¶"Cadastral Survey Rules 2021: r 58(3)"

column1: Rule1102¶"Font size for text"¶"The font size for an appellation and area must be significantly larger than the font size used for vectors, dimensions, descriptions, and survey mark information."¶"Cadastral Survey Rules 2021: sch 7(4)"

Rule1065¶"Former water boundary"¶"An existing water boundary for which the margin of the water body has moved by processes other than accretion or erosion must be adopted as an irregular boundary or converted to one or more right-line boundaries."¶"Cadastral Survey Rules 2021: r 10(3)"

Rule1071¶"Height limited boundary 1"¶"A height limited boundary must be a surface that is mathematically described if any boundary point that is included in the boundary has a reduced level."¶"Cadastral Survey Rules 2021: r 12(2)(a)"

Rule1074¶"Height limited boundary 2"¶"A height limited boundary must be a surface of a water body or the bed of a water body if no boundary point that is included in the boundary has a reduced level."¶"Cadastral Survey Rules 2021: r 12(2)(b)"

Rule1249¶"Height limited boundary point referenced to PRM"¶"A referenced height-limited boundary point must be referenced by a permanent reference mark that has a reduced level."¶"Cadastral Survey Rules 2021: r 31(c); r 34"

Rule1280¶"Height limited boundary points on unit development"¶"The reduced levels in a unit title development must be expressed in terms of the previously deposited CSD for that unit title development."¶"Cadastral Survey Rules 2021: r 62(1)"

Rule1281¶"Height limited boundary points on unit development 2"¶"A vertical control mark that is less than or equal to 1,000 m from a new height limited boundary point in a unit title development must be provided with a reduced level in terms of the unit title development if all of the following are true:

column2: - there is at least one vertical control mark less than or equal to 1,000 m from the boundary point
- an unofficial datum is used in a cadastral survey for the unit title development."¶"Cadastral Survey Rules 2021: r 62(2)"

column1: Rule1293¶"Height limited boundary points on unit development 3"¶"A vertical control mark that is more than 1,000 m from a new height limited boundary point in a unit title development must be provided with a reduced level in terms of a unit title development if all of the following are true:

column2: - there are no vertical control marks that are less than or equal to 1,000 m from the boundary point
- an unofficial datum is used in a cadastral survey for the unit title development."¶"Cadastral Survey Rules 2021: r 62(2)"

column1: Rule1125¶"Horizontal accuracy between adopted Cadastral Survey Network Mark and non-boundary mark 1"¶"The accuracy [relative] between an adopted cadastral survey network mark and each non-boundary mark must not exceed 0.025 + (0.00015 * the horizontal distance between the adopted cadastral survey network mark and the non-boundary mark)."¶"Cadastral Survey Rules 2021: r 20(1)"

Rule1127¶"Horizontal accuracy between adopted Cadastral Survey Network Mark and non-boundary mark 2"¶"The accuracy [relative] between an adopted cadastral survey network mark and each non-boundary mark must not exceed 0.2 m horizontal."¶"Cadastral Survey Rules 2021: r 20(1)"

Rule1126¶"Horizontal accuracy between non-boundary marks 1"¶"The accuracy [relative] between a non-boundary mark and each other non-boundary mark must not exceed 0.025 + (0.00005 * the horizontal distance between the non-boundary marks)."¶"Cadastral Survey Rules 2021: r 19(1)"

Rule1302¶"Horizontal accuracy between non-boundary marks 2"¶"The accuracy [relative] between a non-boundary mark and each other non-boundary mark must not exceed 0.2 m horizontal."¶"Cadastral Survey Rules 2021: r 19(1)"

Rule1407¶"Horizontal Class A accuracy of boundary referencing"¶"A class A boundary point that is a referenced point must be considered an accurately defined boundary point only if the accuracy [relative] between the class A boundary point and each non-boundary mark that is less than or equal to 150 m from the class A boundary point does not exceed 0.03 m horizontal."¶"Cadastral Survey Rules 2021: r 21"

Rule1409¶"Horizontal Class B accuracy of boundary referencing"¶"A class B boundary point that is a referenced point must be considered an accurately defined boundary point only if the accuracy [relative] between the class B boundary point and each non-boundary mark that is less than or equal to 500 m from the class B boundary point does not exceed 0.20 m horizontal."¶"Cadastral Survey Rules 2021: r 21"

Rule1411¶"Horizontal Class C accuracy of boundary referencing"¶"A class C boundary point that is a referenced point must be considered an accurately defined boundary point only if the accuracy [relative] between the class C boundary point and each non-boundary mark that is less than or equal to 1000 m from the class C boundary point does not exceed 0.60 m horizontal."¶"Cadastral Survey Rules 2021: r 21"

Rule1483¶"Horizontal connection for non-primary parcels over water 1"¶"A boundary point that is included in a non-primary parcel boundary must be connected by at least one vector to a cadastral survey network mark if the underlying parcel is a common marine and coastal area."¶"Cadastral Survey Rules 2021: r 70(2)"

Rule1484¶"Horizontal connection for non-primary parcels over water 2"¶"An accuracy [relative] between a boundary point that is included in a non-primary parcel boundary and an adopted cadastral survey network mark must not exceed 0.60 m horizontal if the underlying parcel is a common marine and coastal area."¶"Cadastral Survey Rules 2021: r 70(2)"
Rule1057¶"Horizontal extent of a primary parcel"¶"The horizontal extent of a primary parcel must be defined by only the following:

column2: - a right-line boundary
- an arc boundary
- a water or irregular boundary."¶"Cadastral Survey Rules 2021: r 38(1)"

column1: Rule1035¶"Horizontal extent of non-primary parcel"¶"The horizontal extent of a non-primary parcel must be defined by only the following:

column2: - a right-line boundary
- an arc boundary
- a water or irregular boundary
- a permanent structure boundary."¶"Cadastral Survey Rules 2021: r 46(1)"

column1: Rule1400¶"Impracticable to mark boundary point record"¶"A record of survey must identify a boundary point as impracticable to mark if it is impracticable to mark the boundary point."¶"Cadastral Survey Rules 2021: r 80(6)"
Rule1310¶"Information in Record of Survey 1"¶"A record of survey must include all of the following:

column2: - a survey diagram
- a list of all CSDs used in the cadastral survey
- the identity of any parcel that is to be extinguished
- the dataset description
- a statement of certification from the cadastral surveyor."¶"Cadastral Survey Rules 2021: r 76(a); r 76(b); r 76(d); r 76(e); r 76(g)"

column1: Rule1311¶"Information in Record of Survey 2"¶"A record of survey must include the land district of each CSD used in the cadastral survey if the CSD number of each CSD is not unique."¶"Cadastral Survey Rules 2021: r 76(b)"

Rule1312¶"Information in Record of Survey 3"¶"A record of survey must include the date the cadastral survey was completed if a field measurement is made in the cadastral survey."¶"Cadastral Survey Rules 2021: r 76(c)"
Rule1313¶"Information in Record of Survey 4"¶"A record of survey must include all of the following on every sheet of the record of survey:

column2: - the CSD number
- the sheet number
- the total number of sheets in the record of survey."¶"Cadastral Survey Rules 2021: r 76(f)"

column1: Rule1255¶"Irregular boundary not converted"¶"An existing irregular boundary need not be converted to right-line boundaries if the parcels defined by the boundary are non-primary parcels."¶"Cadastral Survey Rules 2021: r 46(6)"

Rule1254¶"Irregular non-primary parcel boundary"¶"A non-primary parcel boundary must be an irregular boundary if the boundary coincides with an irregular boundary that defines a movable marginal strip or defines an esplanade strip."¶"Cadastral Survey Rules 2021: r 46(5)"

Rule1048¶"Labeling a balance parcel in a CSD"¶"A parcel ID of a balance parcel in a CSD must consist of the prefix \"Part\" added to the parcel ID of the existing parcel that is extinguished when the balance parcel is created."¶"Cadastral Survey Rules 2021: r 42(2)(a); https://jira.linz.govt.nz/browse/STEPBR-147"
Rule1047¶"Labeling a new parcel of land"¶"A parcel ID of a new parcel in a CSD must consist of the following components in the listed sequence:

column2: - a parcel type component
- a unique parcel identifier
- the CSD number
if the parcel is not any of the following:
- a new parcel described as a Maori freehold land
- a balance parcel
- a residue parcel."¶"Cadastral Survey Rules 2021: r 42(1)"

column1: Rule1397¶"Labeling a proposed unit formerly created in a CSD"¶"The parcel ID of a proposed unit created under a previous legislation must be retained."¶"Cadastral Survey Rules 2021: r 42(3)"

Rule1049¶"Labeling a residue parcel in a CSD"¶"A parcel ID of a residue parcel in a CSD must consist of the prefix \"Part\" added to the parcel ID of the existing parcel if the other portion of the existing parcel has been described as any of the following:

column2: - the bed of a lake
- the bed of a river
- part of the common marine and coastal area."¶"Cadastral Survey Rules 2021: r 42(2)(b); r 42(4)"

column1: Rule1042¶"Labelling a new parcel of Maori land"¶"A parcel ID for a new parcel described as a Maori freehold land in a CSD must consist of the following components in the listed sequence:

column2: - a block name or an alternative legal description confirmed by the Maori Land Court
- a unique parcel identifier or an alternative legal description confirmed by the Maori Land Court
- the CSD number."¶"Cadastral Survey Rules 2021: r 44"

column1: Rule1448¶"Land value and water or irregular boundaries"¶"A water or irregular boundary that is not an accepted boundary must have its position determined to a level of accuracy [positional] that takes into account for each parcel that is defined by the boundary all of the following:

column2: - the value of the land
- the intensity of the land use."¶"Cadastral Survey Rules 2021: r 29(2)(e); r 29(3)"

column1: Rule1101¶"Line styles"¶"The styles and widths in table 9 of Schedule 7 of RCS 2020 must be used for lines in a diagram plan. When a line serves more than one purpose, a style higher up the table takes precedence over a style below it. The width of a thick line must be at least twice the width of a thin line."¶"Cadastral Survey Rules 2021: sch 7(3)"
Rule1417¶"Minimum PRMs in a cadastral survey"¶"A cadastral survey must include at least 3 permanent reference marks for which any of the following is true:

column2: - the permanent reference mark is not more than 150 m from a referenced point that is a class A boundary point
- the permanent reference mark is not more than 500 m from a referenced point that is a class B boundary point
- the permanent reference mark is not more than 1000m from a referenced point that is a class C boundary point."¶"Cadastral Survey Rules 2021: r 32(2); r 51(2)(g); r 70(1)"

column1: Rule1174¶"Minimum width of a new primary parcel with class A boundaries"¶"A new primary parcel must be greater than or equal to 0.1 m wide if all of the following are true:

column2: - the boundaries that define the primary parcel are class A boundaries
- the primary parcel is not a balance parcel
- the primary parcel is not a residue parcel."¶"Cadastral Survey Rules 2021: r 40(1)(a); r 40(2)"

column1: Rule1391¶"Minimum width of a new primary parcel with class B, C or D boundaries"¶"A new primary parcel must be greater than or equal to 0.2 m wide if all of the following are true:

column2: - the boundaries that define the primary parcel are not class A boundaries
- the primary parcel is not a balance parcel
- the primary parcel is not a residue parcel."¶"Cadastral Survey Rules 2021: r 40(1)(b); r 40(2)"

column1: Rule1446¶"Movement of water body margin and water or irregular boundaries"¶"A water or irregular boundary that is not an accepted boundary must have its position determined to a level of accuracy [positional] that allows for the potential for the boundary to move or become permanent as a result of movement of the margin of a water body that adjoins the boundary."¶"Cadastral Survey Rules 2021: r 29(2)(c); r 29(3)"
Rule1402¶"Naming a point"¶"A new point in a CSD that is not marked must have a point name that consists of the following components in the listed sequence:

column2: - the abbreviation 'UNMK'
- a unique alphanumeric identifier
- the CSD number."¶"Cadastral Survey Rules 2021: r 80(2)"

column1: Rule1054¶"Naming a survey mark"¶"A new survey mark in a CSD must have a mark name that consists of the following components in the listed sequence:

column2: - an abbreviation describing the physical mark type
- a unique alphanumeric identifier
- the CSD number."¶"Cadastral Survey Rules 2021: r 80(2)"

column1: Rule1241¶"New boundary mark physical properties 1"¶"A new boundary mark must be one of the following if practicable:

column2: - a wooden peg that is chamfered at the top and has a minimum width of 45 mm and is at least 3000 square mm in cross-section
- a type of peg that is not a wooden peg and is clearly labelled as a boundary mark
- a post
- a mark in a post which is clearly labelled as a boundary mark."¶"Cadastral Survey Rules 2021: r 36(1)(a); r 36(1)(b); r 36(1)(c); r 36(1)(d)"

column1: Rule1269¶"New boundary mark physical properties 2"¶"A new boundary mark must be any other type of mark clearly labeled as a boundary mark if it is not practicable to be any of the following:

column2: - a wooden peg that is chamfered at the top and has a minimum width of 45 mm and is at least 3000 square mm in cross-section
- a type of peg that is not a wooden peg and is clearly labelled as a boundary mark
- a post
- a mark in a post which is clearly labelled as a boundary mark."¶"Cadastral Survey Rules 2021: r 36(1)(e)"

column1: Rule1242¶"New boundary mark physical properties 3"¶"A new boundary mark must be soundly anchored in place."¶"Cadastral Survey Rules 2021: r 36(2)(a)"
Rule1306¶"New boundary mark physical properties 4"¶"A new boundary mark must be readily visible if practicable."¶"Cadastral Survey Rules 2021: r 36(2)(b)"
Rule1396¶"New boundary mark physical properties 5"¶"A new boundary mark must be placed at a boundary point."¶"Cadastral Survey Rules 2021: r 36(2)(c)"

Rule1161¶"New primary parcel created in a CSD 1"¶"An existing primary parcel being extinguished by a new primary parcel must have all land in the existing primary parcel included in at least one of the following:

column2: - one or more new primary parcels
- a residue parcel
- a balance parcel."¶"Cadastral Survey Rules 2021: r 39(1); r 39(2)"

column1: Rule1162¶"New primary parcel created in a CSD 2"¶"An existing primary parcel being extinguished by a new primary parcel that is defined by a height limited boundary must have all space occupied by the existing primary parcel included in at least one of the following:

column2: - one or more new primary parcels
- a residue parcel
- a balance parcel."¶"Cadastral Survey Rules 2021: r 39(1); r 39(3)"

column1: Rule1398¶"Non-primary parcel accepted boundaries"¶"A non-primary parcel boundary that coincides with a primary parcel boundary defining an underlying parcel must be considered an accepted boundary if any of the following is true:

column2: - the non-primary parcel boundary is inaccurately determined
- the non-primary parcel overlies a parcel that is the bed of a stream
- the non-primary parcel overlies a parcel that is the bed of a river
- the non-primary parcel overlies a parcel that is the bed of a lake
- the non-primary parcel overlies a parcel that is common marine and coastal area."¶"Cadastral Survey Rules 2021: r 51(2)(a); r 53(2)(a); r 70(1); r 70(2)"

column1: Rule1053¶"Non-primary parcel boundary"¶"A non-primary parcel boundary must be the same boundary form as a boundary that defines an underlying parcel if the boundary that defines the non-primary parcel coincides with the boundary that defines the underlying parcel."¶"Cadastral Survey Rules 2021: r 46(3)"
Rule1282¶"Non-primary parcel boundary mark"¶"A mark need not be placed at a new boundary point that is included in a non-primary parcel boundary."¶"Cadastral Survey Rules 2021: r 63"

Rule1365¶"Non-primary parcel class D boundaries 1"¶"A non-primary parcel boundary that intersects with a primary parcel boundary defining an underlying parcel must be considered a class D boundary if any of the following is true:

column2: - the non-primary parcel boundary is inaccurately determined
- the non-primary parcel overlies a parcel that is the bed of a stream
- the non-primary parcel overlies a parcel that is the bed of a river
- the non-primary parcel overlies a parcel that is the bed of a lake
- the non-primary parcel overlies a parcel that is common marine and coastal area."¶"Cadastral Survey Rules 2021: r 51(2)(a); r 53(2)(a); r 70(1); r 70(2)"

column1: Rule1461¶"Non-primary parcel class D boundaries 3"¶"A non-primary parcel boundary must be a class D boundary if all of the following are true:

column2: - the non-primary parcel boundary is inaccurately determined
- any of the other non-primary parcel boundaries is accurately determined."¶"Cadastral Survey Rules 2021: r 51(3)"

column1: Rule1377¶"Non-primary parcel reference to PRM"¶"A boundary point must be referenced by a permanent reference mark if the boundary point is included in a non-primary parcel boundary and any of the following is true:

column2: - the non-primary parcel boundary is an inaccurately determined class A boundary or class B boundary and the boundary point is not a class D boundary point
- the non-primary parcel overlies a parcel that is the bed of a stream or the bed of a river or the bed of a lake."¶"Cadastral Survey Rules 2021: r 51(2)(h); r 70(1)"

column1: Rule1834¶"Non-primary parcel relation to underlying primary parcels"¶"A non-primary parcel boundary must be accurately determined if the non-primary parcel boundary is not inaccurately determined."¶"Cadastral Survey Rules 2021: Inferred from r 27(4); Inferred from r 51; Inferred from r 53"

Rule1372¶"Non-primary parcel survey bearings"¶"The horizontal projection used in a cadastral survey must be an official geodetic projection applicable to the area that the cadastral survey is carried out in if the cadastral survey includes a non-primary parcel boundary for which any of the following is true:

column2: - the non-primary parcel boundary is inaccurately determined
- the non-primary parcel overlies a parcel that is the bed of a stream
- the non-primary parcel overlies a parcel that is the bed of a river
- the non-primary parcel overlies a parcel that is the bed of a lake
- the non-primary parcel overlies a parcel that is common marine and coastal area."¶"Cadastral Survey Rules 2021: r 51(2)(b); r 53(2)(b); r 70(1); r 70(2)"

column1: Rule1366¶"Non-primary parcel with inaccurate relationship to new primary parcel"¶"A boundary point that is included in a non-primary parcel boundary may be inaccurately determined only if all of the following are true:

column2: - an underlying parcel is created by the cadastral survey
- the boundary intersects or the boundary coincides with an accepted boundary of the underlying parcel at the boundary point
- at least one other non-primary parcel boundary is accurately determined to a class A boundary or class B boundary of the underlying parcel."¶"Cadastral Survey Rules 2021: r 51(4); r 51(5)"

column1: Rule1089¶"Non-primary parcels crossing boundaries"¶"A non-primary parcel may cross a boundary only if the boundary is not an estate boundary."¶"Cadastral Survey Rules 2021: r 47"
Rule1301¶"Official geodetic projections"¶"A geodetic projection must be considered an official geodetic projection if the geodetic projection is any of the following meridional circuit projections:

column2: - Mount Eden 2000
- Bay of Plenty 2000
- Poverty Bay 2000
- Hawkes Bay 2000
- Taranaki 2000
- Tuhirangi 2000
- Wanganui 2000
- Wairarapa 2000
- Wellington 2000
- Collingwood 2000
- Nelson 2000
- Karamea 2000
- Buller 2000
- Grey 2000
- Amuri 2000
- Marlborough 2000
- Hokitika 2000
- Okarito 2000
- Jacksons Bay 2000
- Mount Pleasant 2000
- Gawler 2000
- Timaru 2000
- Lindis Peak 2000
- Mount Nicholas 2000
- Mount York 2000
- Observation Point 2000
- North Taieri 2000
- Bluff 2000."¶"Cadastral Survey Rules 2021: sch 2 definition of \"official geodetic projection\"; sch 3"

column1: Rule1294¶"Official vertical datums"¶"A official vertical datum must be any of the following:

column2: - New Zealand Vertical Datum 2016 or NZVD2016
- One Tree Point 1964
- Auckland 1946
- Moturiki 1953
- Gisborne 1926
- Napier 1962
- Taranaki 1970
- Wellington 1953
- Nelson 1955
- Lyttelton 1937
- Dunedin 1958
- Dunedin – Bluff 1960
- Bluff 1955
- Stewart Island 1977."¶"Cadastral Survey Rules 2021: sch 5"

column1: Rule1287¶"Offset water boundary"¶"A new water boundary that defines a non-primary parcel may be offset from an accepted water boundary only when the new water boundary is at MHWS or MLWS and the non-primary parcel overlies a hydro parcel."¶"Cadastral Survey Rules 2021: r 65; r 68"

Rule1122¶"Orientation - horizontal datum 1"¶"The bearing of each vector in a cadastral survey must be oriented in terms of the same horizontal projection."¶"Cadastral Survey Rules 2021: r 16(1); r 16(3)"

Rule1121¶"Orientation - horizontal datum 2"¶"The horizontal projection used in a cadastral survey must be an official geodetic projection applicable to the area that the cadastral survey is carried out in if all of the following are true:

column2: - the cadastral survey defines or marks a new boundary point that is included in a boundary that defines a primary parcel
- the cadastral survey makes a new field measurement."¶"Cadastral Survey Rules 2021: r 16"

column1: Rule1082¶"Parcel area intended for lease"¶"An area [quantity] must be assigned to a parcel that is intended for a lease if the parcel is not defined by any permanent structure boundaries."¶"Cadastral Survey Rules 2021: r 41(2)"

Rule1084¶"Parcel area quantity"¶"An area [quantity] assigned to a parcel that has a shape that varies with height must equal the area [quantity] of the horizontal extent of the parcel."¶"Cadastral Survey Rules 2021: r 41(4)"
Rule1085¶"Parcel area requirement 1"¶"An area [quantity] assigned to a parcel must be correctly calculated from boundary information of the parcel."¶"Cadastral Survey Rules 2021: r 41(5)(a)"
Rule1392¶"Parcel area requirement 2"¶"An area [quantity] assigned to a parcel must be expressed in hectares."¶"Cadastral Survey Rules 2021: r 41(5)(b)"
Rule1176¶"Parcel area requirement 3"¶"An area [quantity] assigned to a parcel must not be less than 0.0001 ha."¶"Cadastral Survey Rules 2021: r 41(5)(c)"

Rule1175¶"Parcel area requirement 4"¶"An area [quantity] assigned to a parcel may be rounded only to the greater of one part in 1000 of the area [quantity] or 0.0001 ha."¶"Cadastral Survey Rules 2021: r 41(5)(d)"

Rule1077¶"Parcel definition - movable marginal strip"¶"An area [quantity] assigned to a primary parcel must include the area [quantity] assigned to each movable marginal strip in that primary parcel."¶"Cadastral Survey Rules 2021: r 41(1)"
Rule1051¶"Parcel type component"¶"A parcel type component must be determined according to the parcel type component table."¶"Cadastral Survey Rules 2021: r 43"

Rule1265¶"Permanent structure boundary"¶"A permanent structure boundary must follow a described part of a permanent structure or be clearly defined by reference to points on the interior or exterior of a permanent structure."¶"Cadastral Survey Rules 2021: r 56(2)"

Rule1427¶"Permanent structure boundary accuracy A"¶"A permanent structure boundary point must be considered a boundary point that is accurately defined only if the accuracy [relative] between the boundary point and each boundary point that is included in a boundary that defines the same parcel that the permanent structure is on is class A accuracy when the boundary points are both class A boundary points."¶"Cadastral Survey Rules 2021: r 27; r 57(1)"

Rule1432¶"Permanent structure boundary accuracy B"¶"A permanent structure boundary point must be considered a boundary point that is accurately defined only if the accuracy [relative] between the boundary point and each boundary point that is included in a boundary that defines the same parcel that the permanent structure is on is class B accuracy when one of the boundary points is a class B boundary point and the other is any of:

column2: - a class A boundary point
- a class B boundary point."¶"Cadastral Survey Rules 2021: r 27; r 57(1)"

column1: Rule1433¶"Permanent structure boundary accuracy C"¶"A permanent structure boundary point must be considered a boundary point that is accurately defined only if the accuracy [relative] between the boundary point and each boundary point that is included in a boundary that defines the same parcel that the permanent structure is on is class C accuracy when one of the boundary points is a class C boundary point and the other is any of:

column2: - a class A boundary point
- a class B boundary point
- a class C boundary point."¶"Cadastral Survey Rules 2021: r 27; r 57(1)"

column1: Rule1469¶"Permanent structure boundary accuracy D"¶"A permanent structure boundary point must be considered a boundary point that is accurately defined only if the accuracy [relative] between the boundary point and each boundary point that is included in a boundary that defines the same parcel that the permanent structure is on is class D accuracy when one of the boundary points is a class D boundary point."¶"Cadastral Survey Rules 2021: r 27; r 57(1)"

Rule1261¶"Permanent structure boundary parcel intention 1"¶"A permanent structure boundary may define a parcel intended for a right under the Unit Titles Act 2010 only if at least part of the permanent structure related to the permanent structure boundary is located on the same underlying parcels as the unit title development."¶"Cadastral Survey Rules 2021: r 56(1)(a)"

Rule1262¶"Permanent structure boundary parcel intention 2"¶"A permanent structure boundary may define a parcel intended for a lease for which the boundary is located by reference to the permanent structure only if any of the parcels underlying the lease and any part the permanent structure are the same irrelevant of the permanent structure encroaching onto an adjoining parcel.

column2: A permanent structure boundary may define a parcel intended for a lease only if any part of the permanent structure that locates by reference the boundary is located on the same parcel that underlies that lease."¶"Cadastral Survey Rules 2021: r 56(1)(b)"

column1: Rule1263¶"Permanent structure boundary parcel intention 3"¶"A permanent structure boundary may define a parcel intended for a right over or an appurtenant to a base right under the Unit Titles Act 2010 or a base lease for which the boundary is located by reference to the permanent structure only if all of the following are true:

column2: - the right will expire before or at the same time as the base right or base lease
- any of the parcels underlying the base right or the base lease and any part the permanent structure are the same."¶"Cadastral Survey Rules 2021: r 56(1)(c)"

column1: Rule1264¶"Permanent structure boundary parcel intention 4"¶"A permanent structure boundary may define an easement parcel or a covenant parcel only if all of the following are true:

column2: - the use of the easement parcel or covenant parcel is directly related to the permanent structure
- the easement or covenant is expected to become redundant once the permanent structure ceases to exist."¶"Cadastral Survey Rules 2021: r 56(1)(d)"

column1: Rule1428¶"Permanent structure boundary point class A horizontal accuracy"¶"A permanent structure boundary point that is a class A boundary point must be considered a boundary point that is accurately defined only if the accuracy [relative] between the permanent structure boundary point and each point on the permanent structure does not exceed 0.03 m horizontal."¶"Cadastral Survey Rules 2021: r 21; r 57(2)"

Rule1437¶"Permanent structure boundary point class A vertical accuracy"¶"A permanent structure boundary point that is a class A boundary point must be considered a boundary point that is accurately defined only if the accuracy [relative] between the permanent structure boundary point and each point on the permanent structure does not exceed 0.04 m vertical."¶"Cadastral Survey Rules 2021: r 21; r 57(2)"

Rule1438¶"Permanent structure boundary point class B horizontal accuracy"¶"A permanent structure boundary point that is a class B boundary point must be considered a boundary point that is accurately defined only if the accuracy [relative] between the permanent structure boundary point and each point on the permanent structure does not exceed 0.2 m horizontal."¶"Cadastral Survey Rules 2021: r 21; r 57(2)"

Rule1439¶"Permanent structure boundary point class B vertical accuracy"¶"A permanent structure boundary point that is a class B boundary point must be considered a boundary point that is accurately defined only if the accuracy [relative] between the permanent structure boundary point and each point on the permanent structure does not exceed 0.2 m vertical."¶"Cadastral Survey Rules 2021: r 21; r 57(2)"

Rule1441¶"Permanent structure boundary point class C horizontal accuracy"¶"A permanent structure boundary point that is a class C boundary point must be considered a boundary point that is accurately defined only if the accuracy [relative] between the permanent structure boundary point and each point on the permanent structure does not exceed 0.6 m horizontal."¶"Cadastral Survey Rules 2021: r 21; r 57(2)"

Rule1440¶"Permanent structure boundary point class C vertical accuracy"¶"A permanent structure boundary point that is a class C boundary point must be considered a boundary point that is accurately defined only if the accuracy [relative] between the permanent structure boundary point and each point on the permanent structure does not exceed 0.6 m vertical."¶"Cadastral Survey Rules 2021: r 21; r 57(2)"

Rule1447¶"Physical feature water or irregular boundaries"¶"A water or irregular boundary that is not an accepted boundary must have its position determined to a level of accuracy [positional] that takes into account the nature of any physical feature that defines the margin of a water body that adjoins the boundary."¶"Cadastral Survey Rules 2021: r 29(2)(d); r 29(3)"
Rule1081¶"Primary parcel area"¶"An area [quantity] must be assigned to a primary parcel if the primary parcel is not any of the following:

column2: - a residue parcel
- a balance parcel."¶"Cadastral Survey Rules 2021: r 41(1)"

column1: Rule1186¶"Principal Unit"¶"A principal unit must contain a building or be part of a building or be contained within a building or be a car park."¶"Unit Titles Act 2010: s 7; http://www.legislation.govt.nz/act/public/2010/0022/latest/DLM2319229.html"
column2: Survey and Titles Glossary: https://confluence.linz.govt.nz/pages/releaseview.action?pageId=1700818

column1: Rule1028¶"PRM relationship to ground level and situation"¶"A record of survey must describe the relationship of any permanent reference mark to ground level and the situation of the permanent reference mark."¶"Cadastral Survey Rules 2021: r 80(8)"
Rule1326¶"Record of Survey Accepted Boundary Points"¶"A record of survey need not include accepted boundary points used for the purposes of a cadastral survey."¶"Cadastral Survey Rules 2021: r 80(1)"
Rule1321¶"Record of Survey Boundary Information"¶"A record of survey must include the accuracy class of all of the following included in the record of survey:

column2: - a right-line boundary
- an arc boundary
- a height limited boundary."¶"Cadastral Survey Rules 2021: r 79"

column1: Rule1314¶"Record of Survey Datum Information 1"¶"A record of survey must include the meridional circuit projection of the area the cadastral survey is carried out in if a bearing is included in the record of survey."¶"Cadastral Survey Rules 2021: r 77(a)"
Rule1315¶"Record of Survey Datum Information 2"¶"A record of survey must include the vertical datum if a reduced level is recorded in the record of survey."¶"Cadastral Survey Rules 2021: r 77(b)"
Rule1104¶"Record of survey for simple boundary reinstatement CSD"¶"A record of survey for a simple boundary reinstatement survey must include all of the following:

column2: - a reinstatement diagram
- a list of CSDs used and, if a CSD number is not unique, the land district of the CSD
- the date the cadastral survey was completed
- datum information in accordance with rule 76
- vector information in accordance with rule 77
- the accuracy class of each boundary point
- occupation information in accordance with rule 79
- survey mark and point information in accordance with rule 80
- at least 1 measured vector to every new or old survey mark
- measured vectors to at least 2 other non-boundary marks for every new non-boundary mark
- the adopted vectors or calculated vectors used for the purpose of boundary definition
- a dataset description"¶"Cadastral Survey Rules 2021: r 119"

column1: Rule1323¶"Record of Survey Occupation Information 1"¶"A record of survey must include all of the following information about an occupation in graphic form:

column2: - the nature of the physical feature
- the age of the physical feature
- the relationship between the occupation and the boundary or the boundary position."¶"Cadastral Survey Rules 2021: r 81(2)"
